5X-PUhTZOb2wcn5DCgANFg.text: This is a great place to come with friends before a Pirates game!    The pizza is pretty good and the game day special (2013) is a large cheese pizza and a pitcher of domestic beer for $13.00.   The pizza is always fresh.  The sauce is delicious and the crust is a nice hand tossed thin crust.  I've never been disappointed.    The atmposphere is comfortable and the waitstaff are friendly.  It's definitly worth a stop in.

HaJQSHYyGMrJLQflSXyGdQ.text: Myself and co workers went last night and I thought the happy hour was great.  Cheap beer always is a good time.  I ordered the fried zucchini and I thought it was really good.  I would definitely go back.

-9PbiWBuyI3LCGL8miU0aQ.text: This is my favorite place for lunch. I love the pizza. They have a number of lunch specials. Service is outstanding (we always sit in Jens section)  I love the white pizza. Get there early as they fill up for lunch

iG9f42vw537FpuGobioJ6g.text: I was here for business and stayed at a nearby hotel in downtown. They delivered my food (free of charge), but they won't receive an extra star for that because of the TERRIBLE customer service AND they got my order wrong. I was really excited to try the steak ranchero because no. 1 - I love meat, no. 2 - I love french fries and no. 3 - I love ranch dressing! But to no avail, they gave me a plain old steak hoagie. At least they got the extra jalapenos right. Whoopty-freaking-do. The hoagie was definitely nothing to write home about.  Let's get to the terrible customer service... the dude who delivered my food got upset when I tried to pay with my credit card. I mean, don't get mad at me cuz your boss didn't ask me how I was gonna pay. Then, he doesn't give me a receipt. Isn't it customary to provide a copy of the receipt when you deliver on the east coast? I'm from California and that's freaking standard, man! Wouldn't you think if you're delivering to a hotel, the person is probably traveling for business and would need to provide supporting receipts in order to receive reimbursement for meal expenses? Come on now! So I kindly asked the hotel front desk to make a copy of the receipt. They were taking some time to make a copy so we stood there awkwardly trying NOT to make eye contact because it was OBVIOUS he was annoyed. Hey buddy, don't be upset with me because you hate your job! When I gave him the receipt and said thank you (yes, I still was polite even through all the awkwardness), he just walked away. No bye, no have a great night, no nothing. I don't know why I was expecting anything more from this guy.  Maybe I would have had a better experience if I walked in to place my order instead, but judging on the previous reviews, I highly doubt that.

OFplFn0WJOR1xkvTs5Qhjw.text: Love this place.  Quick, inexpensive and fun. Good food.  Great for after the Pirates games and before a matinee theater date.

9VZoEp5oZdbZIsvxSbBN1A.text: Cafe Milano has been my go-to stop for inexpensive and yummy food ever since I was lead in there by my co-workers when I was working as an usher at Heinz Hall back in 2005.  This is a very casual, low-key restaurant, so anyone looking for a more high-end atmosphere is going to want to look elsewhere.  But if you want a place with terrific food and plentiful portions, this is the place to go.  Cafe Milano has really cleaned up it's act a lot just in the past couple years or so.  They have their kitchen and small eating area on their main floor and an actual dining room up on the second floor, and both of these areas have been remodeled and cleaned up a lot.  This place definitely used to fit the definitely of a "whole-in-the-wall" type of restaurant, but they've really improved the aesthetics of the restaurant, making it much more appealing for anyone glancing in from the sidewalk. The mood and service of the staff is kind of hit or miss.  The kitchen staff tends to be a bit cranky (I know they're quite moody on the phone) and I've heard the delivery guys are pretty rude, so that's definitely a downside. The attentiveness of the waitresses upstairs can range from really great to pretty distracted.  But then again, they have a lot to pay attention to.  If I come in on a weekday after work, there is always just one waitress attending to the entire dining room and everyone at the bar.  So if your service is on the slow side, I'm sure it's because your waitress is being pulled in wayyyy too many directions at once.  Now on the food.  My favorite items on the menu can be found in their hoagies and pizza section.  I stick with an 8" hoagie (which is considered their "half" hoagie) and it's always plenty to eat.  My favorite hoagie is their ranchero steak, which is a steak hoagie topped with cheese, french fries, and ranch sauce.  Pssst, here's a little hint:  Ask for the buffalo fries in place of the french fries, it gives it a little extra kick and definitely stands out amidst all the meat, cheese, and sauce!  I also love the fish, eggplant, eggplant parm, and vegetable hoagies.  They all come fully stuffed with goodies and are so filling! Okay, pizzas.  Where to even start.  I guess if I had to pick a favorite it would be the broccoli & chicken.  Then of course there's the BBQ chicken, five cheese, ranchero (chicken), hawaiian.....I mean, they're all fabulous.  And they're generously portioned too.  A lot of these are considered gourmet pizzas so the prices are going to be higher than your basic pepperoni, but think of if this way:  If there are two of you, split a small.  If there's four, split a medium.  Trust me, you will have plenty to eat.  So now for the best part about this restaurant:  They're always open.  No not 24/7 open, but whenever a restaurant should be open, they're open.  Want a pizza at 11pm on a Wednesday night?  They're open.  Coming out a Sunday matinee performance and realizing that around 5pm the entire downtown area of Pittsburgh turns into a ghost town?  Cafe Milano will be open.  I can't tell you how many late dinners I've eaten at this restaurant over the years after coming out of a shift at work or a performance down the street.  It's just straight up, no frills, tasty as can be, comforting food.

jPIjFf5gbI2B8YvMJRRUnQ.text: Stopped in for Pizza Rolls/Puffs for a snack while exploring downtown. These were recommended by a fellow traveler. We were greeted  immediately by a friendly staff. The pizza rolls are the best I have ever had and will be a required stop every time in Pittsburg

Ki2v22Cvli_-87XSZDVJpw.text: I was a little confused by the layout of this restaurant when I first walked in.  It was immediately following a game at PNC Park, so they were selling pizza by the slice on the street.  There was also a counter inside to place a full order, which is what we did. We then took a seat on the lower level   but later figured out that there is an upstairs area with a bar and waiter service.  Good to know if you're looking to get a beer with your pizza.  The pizza, however, is the same whether you order upstairs or downstairs.  And it's pretty decent.  This is a perfect stop after a ball game.

0ImE_Cw0dNh9Mnf-XpiqIg.text: Went to an afternoon Reds-Pirates game and afterwards wanted some pizza. Across the river from PNC Park there is Cafe Milano and it looked like a good place for some pizza. There are two floors, downstairs is just pizza and soft drinks, upstairs there is a bar. While the pizza wasn't amazing, I did enjoy it and it filled my pizza craving. It was also decently priced. The leftovers also made for a great late night snack later that  evening. Cafe Milano is a good spot if you are looking for good pizza after a Pirates game.

qLaOAqFj8d2LvnnkPkT0iQ.text: The food was great! (I had the meatball sandwich). A half sub was definitely enough to fill me up. It wasn't a very busy place when I went, but that may have been because of the weather. Pricing was decent, atmosphere followed, but great eats!

oJVl5K96KxY_kYPesYd52w.text: The Cafe Milano needs to do a much better job of matching its menu to things it can do well.  On a visit earlier this week, they were out of coffee, out of guacamole, served cocktail sauce, not ketchup, with deep fried onion rings, and smothered their wings with overpowering barbecue sauce.  The only saving grace was a Tuscan chicken hoagie, which was very good.  That hoagie convinced me that if you want to have a good experience at Cafe Milano you better stick to things like pizza, hoagies or other standard Italian fare, apparently their strong points based on our visit.

69DYeGWLrAlxWFvo2_YxEA.text: I've been here both times I visited Pittsburgh. Its a really good spot for italian and/or hoggies. Be care though, their hoggies are REALLY big, so come with an appetite.

akZ7WXOgXIaZWDICIlAtrg.text: While this place is nothing to look at, The food is terrific. I've had several things now and everything is wonderful with generous portions. If you are looking for a greek salad?, Unbelievable! it's pretty busy during lunch but almost empty at Dinner and yet the food is still wonderful.

xF23biwzDNwhF0I-uIZspg.text: this particular location is great for pre/post-game Pirates as its right downtown on the other side of the river from PNC Park.  lower area has seating for lunch, and upstairs is a bar/restaurant area. the bar can be seedy at times, but nice enough to have a few brews with lunch/dinner.  the food is phenomenal. the ny-style pizza is one of the best in (and out of) the city, but the variety of the menu goes way beyond. apps/wings/soups/salads/pastas/etc.. ive tried a lot of this menu and im always satisfied.  my fave item is probably the buffalo chicken hoagie. incredible. chicken-cheese-sauce-buffalo fries... half a hoagie here is a large portion. the chicken parm is also a great sub.  with daily happy hour, pirates game specials and weekend deals its a no-brainer to knock back a few and try some food.

B8-_DL9gnAJgwRCyTehrJA.text: Ordered a couple of plain slices and they were HUGE!  Shoulda gone with 1 slice.  Crust and sauce were great but there was waaaayyy too much extremely chewy cheese on them.  Could have been a fluke I suppose but the amount of cheese made these less than fun to eat.  Still, good pizza, good staff, fair prices.

6yqOwQcI9qVwctL1zICAxA.text: I live about a block away and I come here often. Usually just to have a few drinks, but I do eat here from time to time. The bar is upstairs. Amy is absolutely the best bartender!!! Ask her to make you a drink/shot that "tastes good," and she will make you a very tasty concoction!!! I won't even order a drink if anyone else is working. They have a drink special everyday of the week. Some better than others, but you can get drinks for $3 a piece. And it's all day, not just for happy hour.  Now onto the food. The calzones are HUGE!!! Definitely split them with another person. They always arrive quick and hot.  Never had a bad sandwich here, but none stands out in my mind. Probably because I always have to get the kind my boyfriend likes.  Now for the PIZZA. This is absolutely the best pizza you can get in downtown. I know, I know, what's the difference? Pizza is pizza. Well, I don't know what they do to it but it's great!!! The maintenance guy in our building, who has lived there for 7+ years, got us turned onto it and now that is the only pizza we eat. You definitely gotta try it. We only get the pepperoni, and it's excellent!!! Have been wanting to try one of their specialty pizza's but they are a little out of my price-range (hmmm...booze or food?) But their prices are reasonable, especially for downtown. Definitely check it out.

iNmgMwstN7qANSJj7cb7Qw.text: After having walked all day with two crazy kids, this was a nice spot to sit and relax before the Pirates game. So smart of them to have pizza for sale outside, that's what drew us in. The pizza was so good that in still craving it now. The garlic knots were good too and the the soda size was generous.

HYndCoySMHlzTboUKsJghA.text: Cafe Milano is another gem in Downtown Pittsburgh.  They've got a fairly extensive menu here--calzones, hoagies, signature sandwiches, salads, gyros, and of course a very comprehensive pizza menu.    Milano's really good for a quick lunch.  They have pizza by the slice here and individual mini-pizzas too.  I ordered two slices, each with pepperoni and mushrooms.  I figured if I couldn't finish both, I could have one tomorrow.  And as we all know, pizza's great the 2nd day.  Good pizza here, and if you can tear yourself away from work for a proper lunch hour, do like I did and get a couple of slices or a sandwich to go and take it over to a nearby plaza for a little al fresco dining.

qyxEWCuHwf767TzGShJ3Hg.text: Our boss had pizzas delivered for lunch today. Love Milano pizza it's the best in downtown  pittsburgh . We had a sausage pizza, banana pepper pizza, and pepperoni.

GXtJpVDX2rU5bi8uvQf0ow.text: Never again. We were planning to attend a Pirates game and passed by this cafe. When you walk in, there is no host/ hostess to seat you. We were told to, "Go upstairs". We climbed the stairs to the second floor and sat at a table next to the wall. About 10 minutes after sitting down, a waitress came and slapped down 4 paper plates. We  ordered a large pizza and Greek salad which both came out relatively quick. The pizza was fair, and the salad was a joke. It came with two plastic dressing packets thrown into the bowl, and was not worth the cost. The service was slow, the clientele consists of obnoxious drunkards, and the food is mediocre at best. If you're looking for a nice family meal go some place else! We saw plenty of options nearby.

pXbWMwGcdtIdaJTWpD-Mnw.text: It was good pizza not great. The service was attentive and knowledgeable, quick and helpful. The menu is standard pizza fare with a couple house specialties. Nothing to write home about, just your standard bar pizza.

Yff9l2Jg0Lb8ldf_VqdLHg.text: From New York, home where pizza first started.. This place had delicious pizza and crust!! Not even that greasy! Just right

3AFHCU054hYMhzwx1XnkCQ.text: My first visit to Pittsburgh to take in a Pirates game.  After leaving PNC Park and walking across the Roberto Clemente bridge we ran into this little gem of a place.  They had an outside warmer selling pizza by the slice - large slices.  What else can I say?  Pure heaven for after a ballgame.

cIBXOo44qWnUTxSsV0lptw.text: Good food. Great place to go before or after a Pirates game. There is a full bar upstairs.  The pizza is amazing. The drinks are really good too!

jFm3I-IroqUGcMwRyPdJWA.text: While visiting the Burgh to take in all of the biking trails this magnificent city now has to offer, we stayed at The Priory on the North Shore and they recommended Cafe Milano for their food and delivery service.  We ordered the Gourmet Supreme Italian Hoagie, and I have to say, that this was absolutely one of the very BEST that we ever tasted.  It was chock full of meats, veggies and cheeses and just the right spices and was still warm, as was the small pizza (which we had no room for after the hoagie).  The call-in order process (they have online ordering as well) and delivery was fast and efficient.  We will definitely be ordering from Cafe Milano on our return trips to our old hometown.

K4dWgw9KZWMF8CKTCQIPmw.text: Everytime I call here I have a hard time having a conversation with the people that answer. It's loud, multiple people answer the phone, and I never know if they want my name/number, which ultimately makes me feel foolish and the desire to order from them again is gone. Today I ordered garlic knots and baked ziti. The ziti was fine, nothing special, but I definitely did not receive garlic knots. Instead, I got sort of donuts covered in garlic. They were fine, they just weren't what I ordered, and that's not ok.

Di1LVqiwHKO43x7GD0AHnQ.text: So...my first mistake was ordering from this place for delivery.  Ordered a bacon cheeseburger, broccoli puffs, and a stromboli, and 2 two liters of Dew.  What arrived was a calzone, 1 two liter of Dew, a cheeseburger with bacobits sprinkled on it, and broccoli puffs that were A) Obiously store bought/not fresh made B) tasted okay, but nothing to write home about.  Also had the delivery person first tell me to meet him in the lobby of the hotel I was staying at...then call me as I was waiting in the lobby from the floor I was staying on.  My SECOND mistake was letting friends drag me to this place to sit down and eat after my first negative experience.  Tried the chicken and broccoli alfredo this time...only to have the waitress give 'my' order to someone at another table and then try to give me their chicken alfredo without broccoli.  They corrected it, but it resulted in my getting my food dead last in our group.  The food was...not horrid...but as I'm still sitting there, trying to eat, suddenly she's pushing boxes and checks at people...making me feel like they just wanted us out and gone.  Place was a ghost town at 12:30pm...and I can definitely tell why.

fe1tmdn2tKlxvw9E5fpXVQ.text: Amazing pizza and fantastic prices! I have eaten here twice with my family and friends before Pirate games and it is a delicious and more affordable option to the ballpark food and prices.

OL2bB8xdFZb9FRRRFE4Mvw.text: I order from Milano way more often than I should.  Their pizza is soooo good.  I typically get the two topping special of pepperoni and extra cheese.  And they don't cheap out on the cheese!  They literally pile it on like what EXTRA CHEESE should be.  Also, their cheesesteak is pretty awesome as well and I recommend it.

99QXLLCHERCEkgYT6-5Ycw.text: Love this place!  Very low key and terrific food.  The pizza is amazing!  We got one that had everything on it including bacon and it was delicious.  I am a huge crust person, and their crust was tasty! Great place to go at any time, but especially late night.  Service and food were both great.  and the pricing won't break the bank.  I would definitely recommend going here if in the downtown area.  We walked here from the Omni.

xGOCmj3zgbMdv0SIv5L4wQ.text: Had a most excellent seafood sub. Lots of crab meat and shrimp. Received order quickly.

eHivk2Lw36ksL54x4VgvIQ.text: Someone ordered pizza for us for lunch at work the other day from Cafe Milano, and I thought it was very good. I don't normally go nuts for pizza, either. It wasn't the best ever but is worth trying.

iPKTUKrBMwqCt8F9vmJiBA.text: Got into the Pitts very late and need some yummy food to eat! Guest services from the Hotel said their buffalo wings was the shiz so I had to come check it out since they are open late and haz a full bar. My girl friend and I headed upstairs... the music was popping up there and I thought there was a party going on! Haha nope just a few girls hanging out and a digital juke box. The place wasn't busy and the server that took our order seem like she was running a marathon in there, but was nice. We just ordered wings, it was cooked well, and was really good.

L7slPA9k3qHa22DZgQ8cGw.text: Had a great dinner here before a show. Mom had a pizza which was awesome, hot and fresh. I had an Italian sub which was tasty. The side salads were even really good. Loved the view from where we sat. This is a small, inexpensive place to eat and enjoy. Highly recommended and so close the the place where our show, Potted Potter was-The Byham Theater.

1g32aEbbKy7LFBgI9MP5NQ.text: Very good atmosphere, family oriented dining, and most importantly, the wings were delicious.

YmJtBK-qmuCLe5XHEsu3xw.text: typical ny type pizza. ok but nothing earthshaking. they sell slices out on the street when there are baseball games.

Q4zPkrTRkhb5GtG0pUkJDw.text: I went to Pizza Milano for lunch with a group of 5 coworkers on a casual Monday around 11:45AM (their choice).   I have been to the restaurant in the past and have had sub par food and service, so was not expecting much to begin with.   What ended up happening was one of the worst downtown dining experiences I have had to date.  To begin, our waitress took too long to come over to greet us.  Once she did all she said was "you ready?"  Sure ma'am... I guess we are.  We all ordered simple items, a small pepperoni pizza, small mushroom pizza and side salad, buffalo chicken salad, sandwich and onion rings, and I ordered a small broccoli pizza and a side salad.  We all ordered water or soft drinks.  I received my side salad first, with no silverware and packet dressing.  The other diner who ordered a side salad, never received hers.  The buffalo chicken salad came out next 5-7 minutes later.  Overall, the diner said it was fine and a good size, but again came with packet dressing.  Next came the pepperoni pizza (fine) and the mushroom pizza (also fine) - which came in the wrong size.  Still no silverware or drinks.  Finally,  we receive silverware and the sandwich and onion rings which were decent.  Still no drinks, and my pizza is nowhere to be found.  At this time, another waitress comes up to our table and proceeds to argue with our waitress IN FRONT OF US about she gave our diner the wrong pizza.  After their argument, I remind them that I am still missing my food and we are still lacking drinks.  We have now hit 12:20PM.  They clearly forgot my Pizza all together, because 10 minutes later they tell me they are cooking it and it should be out soon.  I received my pizza at 12:45 after one of our diners had to leave to go back to work.  No apology, no admittance of the mess up, nothing.  Once I received my pizza, it was fine, but overall the quality of the food here does not compare with other places.   We finally received our checks at 1:15PM which were incorrect (at this point expected).  They made zero effort to rectify the many mistakes other than telling me that they took $1.50 off of my check.    Needless to say, Cafe Milano will no longer be receiving my business as there are MANY other Pizza restaurants in downtown which exceed them in both service and food quality.  I would highly recommend going to Monte Cellos or Giovanni's instead when you are looking for a quick pizza lunch downtown.

hAkaM1g2D1XUcdEZ57c4Fw.text: This is my favorite pizza, the hoagies are really good too. I have been to several locations, they are all good. I love the seafood hoagie and pizza. The pepperoni pizza here is really good. The perogie pizza is good and the chicken hoagie with cheese.

O-n5sC2GqgbLj9qcujCfCg.text: Well... the food is good but definitely not worth the shitty service. We sat at the bar last night to watch the game and get some food and drinks. There were 3 bartenders. None of them pour drinks consistently. They never ask you for a refill or if you'd like another drink. They actually barely ever speak to customers just each other. The girl bartender was actually sitting on the floor behind the bar on her phone at one point for about 5-10 minutes. I realize they're young but come on..... There was also a period of about 15 minutes where there was NO ONE behind the bar at all. Then, one of them had the audacity to whine about being stiffed by the people next to us. WHY ARE YOU SURPRISED??? The best part of that is the other guy telling him to just add money to their check to make up for it. Right in front of other customers. Trust me if the game wasn't on I would have left after the first five minutes of being there.   Pizza - great Wings - can't really cook a wing wrong  Drinks - sometimes too strong sometimes just juice  If I ever came back here it would be for takeout pizza only. The managers/owners need to get a handle on this place for real.

VUl7QG7Pukr6coIs9yWFuQ.text: This used to be my "go to" spot prior to Steelers games for the last 3-4 years, however, I just don't wanna deal with the shitty attitude of the head waitress upstairs anymore so I'm done with Cafe Milano.  I'm giving this place 3 stars because of the food and nothing else.  The pizza is GREAT!  I've read other reviews and saw folks trashing it, but I always get a slice of pepperoni and it's enough to fill me up before the game and it tastes great.  The last time I was in Pittsburgh was for the Patriots game.  We got to Pittsburgh early and as per usual went to Cafe Milano to eat and hangout.  We're sitting there eating, drinking and watching the early game in London and then out of nowhere the check is put on our table by the mean looking waitress.  If you've been there more than once, you know who I'm talking about.  She doesn't ask us if we're done or if we want anything else - just plops it down.  WTF!  We were one of only maybe 3 tables in all of the upstairs area. Like I said, I've been here dozens of times and have never had this happen before.  What I've always seen before and have noticed numerous times is that she NEVER smiles or extends any kind of pleasantries with my party.  I'm not the type to complain, but shit, when you voluntarily work in a business that deals with customers - try treating them more than like they're a pain in your ass and doing you a favor for being there.    We found a better spot a couple doors down after the game.  That place is our new "go to" before all Steelers games going forward.

d9GKpuMuKgSTWDIk9lfUFw.text: Overall good quality and tasting New York style pizza!   My one complaint has nothing to do with the food which is great! I was nervous at first when the woman who answered the phone was not the friendliest when I was ordering but the pizza made up for the lack of service.   Everything else was great. It came within 45 minutes. A large pie & 2 liter soda goes for around $15. The pizza was really delicious!   I will definitely be ordering again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Milano - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pizza was great

cvYpLoJN-cNOeeAyInWLGA.text: My youngest son and I were going to see a show and we wanted to have diner first. We were running rather late so we decided to just get a pizza. We ordered a small cheese pizza. It took quite awhile for it to come. It seemed their bigger concern was having pizzas out front where they were selling slices to people heading to the Pirate game. When we finally got our pizza we had 10 minutes left to eat it. The pizza lacked flavor. It was very bland. I was bummed. I was glad we only ordered a small. It was inexpensive thankfully.  No need for a second visit.

SjPCPEcIB9ymaI_ZVCpGsw.text: If you don't mind dining with riff raft and low life's this is the place for you. Stopped in tonight after the Steelers game and although the restaurant had many women and children in it , they allowed a butch of rowdy fans to use F & MF bombs continuously without regard for the others in the restaurant . Couldn't tell you how the food and service was because after my drink 's came I got disgusted and left . Who allows this behavior in a restaurant? I guess Cafe Milano does . Stay away . Better places in Pittsburgh.

lTX79jCUsrgIDLEx1iWKbA.text: This is a solid place to get a slice of pizza when you are on your way to a Pirates game. It is right across the Roberto Clemente bridge from PNC Park, so my husband and I often stop at their outdoor pizza stand to grab a quick cheap dinner before a game. The slices of pizza are $3 each and ENORMOUS. One slice is easily two slices at most other places and takes up an entire paper plate. The pizza is good, usually fresh and hot. The pizza stand outside is cash only.

ln1rSV-fRMM3DZ6F36N1Mw.text: Greek salad, Popcorn chicken and a Greek pizza. No complaints, but nothing I would feel like I absolutely had to have again. The pizza has a thicker crust, and was super cheesy which I like. The service was good, food came out on time piping hot.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Milano - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Greek pizza

7SOj7BTOcfIrHICBP1Sqhw.text: Terrible service. Our order was given to the wrong person, yet it was somehow our fault and they did nothing to correct it. Overpriced for basic food. Will NOT be coming back!

Q5r6p-Se4agwgv_AdrpHyw.text: Over priced food wasn't that great super greasy and soggy we ordered hoggie and wedges sandwiches oh and it took 2 hours to get our food we were told 45 minutes ( we had to call and make sure they were brining it to us!)

OwXz0LTFeDd4oaRlr_wNDg.text: A couple friends and I stumbled in here from the blizzard conditions last weekend to warm up, grab a bite to eat and an IPA after the Gallery Crawl. We ordered the garlic knots and the Hawaiian pizza. Although we were pretty much the only table in the entire place (re: blizzard conditions), the food hit the spot and the wait staff was extremely chill. Definitely check it out next time you have a hankering for hearty Italian-American food and happen to be downtown.

rtC1r3u8h4PQgzfPhP25mw.text: Excellent local watering hole.  Their drinks are some of the cheapest Downtown and good for them for doing it too.  They could easily charge higher prices since they are located so close to the Cultural District.  The pizza is insanely good and I have never left disappointed.  They way they make their pizza is to layer cheese than toppings than more cheese and trust me Cafe Milanos does not skimp on toppings. Besides the cheap drinks and delicious pizza I also like that they sale a mini pizza and it's every bit as good as it's larger cousins.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Milano - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cafe Milano - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

19Og90Kl7Poh66A56qIvsw.text: We had some family from out of town come in for the US open. This was just what we needed. The hoagies are FANTASTIC!!! I'v never had the spinach and feta rolls but will order them every time I'm here.

fzrLDgJiOVfV8rOEVTFHig.text: As a concierge across the street at a Renaissance (4 diamond rating, one of only three in the city.), I used to frequent this place after work. They have a nice dining room with a small bar upstairs. But after many continued un-provoked RUDE service by the bar manager, I will no longer go there nor recommend them to ANY guests. I now gladly send them to Proper (A wood fire really cool Pizza place on 7th street, just one street over with good service.), Il Pizziaolo in Market square, merely a two and a half block walk from the hotel. (which is phenomenal by the way). Or Giovanni's which is literally right next door to the Renaissance.   Milano's is also over priced for what it is. However,if you enjoy a RUDE bar manager upstairs with horrible customer service and acts like her CUSTOMERS are an inconvenience then you should 100% go there. Cause, that's fun.

rvy0ZXh0dc0HLllgwaVCbA.text: I had to toss the salad I ordered today for delivery. I opened it, and it smelled like old vegetables. The cucumbers were so old, they were transparent. The tomatoes were mealy. The lettuce was wilted. Got a slice to go with, but it's partially burnt (cheese is black on top). OMG. NEVER again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Milano - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Well done (and not in a good way)

jRoyvEuE648fB_JO2iKKxg.text: Cafe Milano.. Located in several locations around the Pittsburgh area, Cafe Milano is one of the better Pizza delivery places in the city. I can't say I have tried everything on the menu (As there is quite a plethora of options) but what I can tell you is that of the 100 times I have called, they have always been nice to the point where they would even offer up coupons to save me money...strange but True.  One of the more memorable items on the list is something I urge you to order if you are ever in an adventurous mood. The Ranchero Pie is the mother of all pizza. What will taste like Heaven in your mouth can soon turn to a cheese covered Hell if you are foolish enough to take on a medium pizza of this ranchero'ness by yourself. 4 hours, eat one Ranchero Pie, that is my challenge to you, the last man to take on this challenge only succeeded by using his own tears as lubrication as he slid the last slice into his gullet.   Pizza challenge aside, the food is pretty good, some of the better pizzas I have had and if you aren't in the mood for that, they have plenty of other items like calzones, pasta, salads and hoagies if that's where you find your appetite to be. If you are in delivery range, give them a go and if you are up for a challenge...take my pizza challenge....I dare you.

uhhsNp6uUkbvumlljXHexA.text: My boyfriend and I live in lancaster and we visited pittsburgh over the weekend and we were looking for a good pizza shop so we went here and it was so good!!! The shop smells so good as soon as you walk in!   I would say this is the best pizza in town. I would definitely go back.

pKdJaQxXCK3TbMylz5WIVg.text: I was staying at the Renaissance hotel across the street and decided to stop here because it was so cold out I didn't want to go far for dinner. I ordered a small half cheese/half pepperoni. The pizza was not bad more doughy then I usually like. It kinda reminded me of Domino's pizza. Service was fast. Overall I would come back to eat if I wanted something close to the hotel and inexpensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Milano - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small pizza. Half cheese and half pepperoni.

JtCG_HoaFmLkqHAOYdjdfg.text: Yea there food is ok but I don't understand how do you deliver to every neighborhood with in 3-5 miles but you can deliver to a predominately black neighborhood. First it was you don't deliver past 10 now it's 8. Make up your mind. Then I can to the restaurant an your workers don't always wear gloves no hair nets an they were playing in their hair. I was a faithful customer until now.

zn901o_Dj8dDw6ThQb8nLg.text: I ordered 5 pizzas for lunch for everyone at work and it arrived on time. The pizza is very good.. different from other pizza houses..  fresh and very delicious.     The salads I must say are decent.  I am weary of ordering them as "take out" because you never know what you are going to get.  We had several salad orders and all were fresh and delicious (iceberg).   Nice selection of salad dressing too.   Thanks Cafe Milano! !! !

TQc7AWDw_aCW8-GTlP68XA.text: I ordered online tried to cancel HOURS before it was to be delivered- at first was told that they would put my name down and they would just give me a free pizza later - um no - give me my money back. I've called twice after that and was told someone would call me back. NOTHING. How is it that you can't cancel an order and they just keep your money?! NEVER ORDERING AGAIN.

1z0y2fGAufiFOHYGUQrq4w.text: I went here with a group during a family outing. We all ordered at the same time and for some reason, my wife's food and my food never came out. We literally did not get our food for 30-45 minutes AFTER everyone else's food was brought to the table. The waitress was apologetic but a manager never approached us despite asking for one. We had part of our meal comped, but only after requesting it.   When we got our food, my wife's wrap wasn't correct. I finally got my calzone and had to rush through it as the rest of our group was already way done eating their meal.   Definitely not coming here again next time we are in Pittsburgh.

WfhlgfI_eJTpV9PIftl4vw.text: This place was great. Kind of randomly ended up here after coming across the bridge from the North Side. It's a spacious place, they had TVs so we we're able to watch a few games that were on. They had whiskey sours on special and they were pretty decent. They sell pizza by the slice and their pizza was fantastic. Service was fine. Prices are very reasonable, especially for the drinks. Nice little spot.

vlP_9gCRmhCNMYxYvwBllA.text: The start of our experience was, how do say, odd. Why, you may ask? Well, they had one menu. One! 10 tables seating about 40 people and one menu. We asked for more... That was challenging. We got a pizza, cheese sticks and a salad. All good and brought to the table quickly. Easy place to go to when going to the Byham.

sa3nBzwGivujU2_17FXA7A.text: This place is fantastic, I always do delivery and they amaze me at how fast they are. There stuffed shells and hot sausage are hard to beat.  The specialty hoagie is a beast and always been great. A#1 place for me!! Simple fast and always friendly delivery. Keep up the GREAT SERVICE.

9rgPPDq1Hb5sDWoJ0LMHfg.text: Aside from the wonderful memories I've made at Cafe Milano, a restaurant at which I've eaten for over ten years now, it has the most unique atmosphere. The downstairs area for family is extremely convenient for me and my friends, since none of us likes to be around children. The upstairs is where the magic happens. It's where they keep the bar, the soft drinks, and the bathrooms. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I've only ever ordered one thing: Mediterranean pizza. They are one of the few places that still has this kind of pizza and it just so happy happens to be my ultimate favorite pizza. Nowhere else has it. It has been the perfect place for me and my friends, as we have eaten there every Wednesday night at five o'clock (back in the old days) where we made memories and ate amazing pizza. Highly highly highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Milano - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

5racCxPTTYfrMUBP7p_xYg.text: Best. Grinders. Ever. - honestly, I've never had a better Italian or cheese steak sandwich. The rolls and meats are amazing..

nz8QGVD1V3UsjOadIfE3Rw.text: Was suggested this place by a local. I was in the mood for greasy pizza for this hit the spot!! Great service and price. The cheese, pepperoni and sauce were so good I wasn't going to eat the crust but one bite of the crust and I couldn't stop! Will definitely stop next next time we're downtown.

U3fl68WRPx2AxkiU_CcHWw.text: Cafe Milano is one of my go-to backup options every time that I'm downtown and my original restaurant plans get thwarted by crowds. There is almost never a wait at Cafe Milano and the food is consistently good. It's not pizza that will change your life, but they make a solid pie. The crust is your standard chewy Pittsburgh pizza crust, the cheese and toppings are plentiful, and their red sauce is flavorful, if not a bit on the sweet side. They also offer a variety of specialty pizzas that are delicious...most recently we ordered the buffalo chicken pizza and weren't disappointed. The service every time we've been there has been friendly and we usually get our food rather quickly (which is important when you're trying to make a show or other event). The main restaurant area is upstairs and then they have a take-out counter and seating on the lower level when you first walk in. During Pirates games, they're usually outside selling big slices of pizza for a few bucks, which is a cheap and tasty option if you need to eat on the run before the game. Overall, I think it's definitely one of the better options downtown for quick, inexpensive, and tasty pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Milano - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo chicken pizza

ZxLFBUwvbsnCmbV-xXRbUg.text: A group of my coworkers and I came here for lunch and we were seated in their upstairs dining room. For peak lunch hour on a Monday, the place was surprisingly close to being empty. People slowly came in after our group sat down but not enough to fill the place. Our group of 13 ordered two extra large pies to share with a few also ordering salads. Our waitress might have been new as she seemed new and unsure of most of the questions we were asking her. She was definitely quite flustered with a group of 13, which is to be expected.   The pizza was pretty average: what you'd expect of typical pizza fare. Pricing was also average, but lunch specials seemed to be good deals. Although the extra large pie was pretty large, the slices were really small. I guess this is ok for big groups, yet three slices was like one normal slice if you ordered pizza by the slice.   Overall, I'm not sure when I'll come back as there are so many other good places in town, although I wouldn't eliminate it as an option completely.

7HSipl4uj9-Pyu_AOnyW6w.text: Awesome lunch spot downtown. Plenty of specials options - there is something for everyone in your group. Instead of a special, I tried the Buffalo chicken salad which was phenomenal - crispy chicken and topped with Buffalo chips (fries) and plenty of fresh veggies - a plentiful portion! They have a large upstairs area which seems to fill up at lunch time. I will definitely return!

3-jlZiX7jy3YW45_Pu8E7Q.text: This is my go to place for delivery. I usually get a pizza, the pepperoni rolls and the Mediterranean salad. They even have a good "white" pizza sauce for those who can't have red sauce. My order is always correct and delivered in a timely manner.

xGHEyfC2M5rGXHVxCAXUZQ.text: Our experience here was great, the cashier was very kind, the service was fast, all Staff were enjoyable and the food was amazing!

AiCsHKua1fDcQJauiCS1Tw.text: I visited Cafe Milano tonight solo for a quick dinner before seeing Phantom of the Opera at the Benedum.  I approached the counter and first asked if they had any dinner specials, which they didn't.  In light of that, I attempted to order a mini (6") pie, which the woman behind the counter told me that I didn't want, since it was "retardedly small."  I told her I usually order two slices of pizza, and asked her which size I should get, and she said the small, and maybe even the medium.  "Really?  It's just for me." I said, and proceeded to order a plain small ($8.12 w/ tax).  I'm glad I used my common sense, since I wasn't looking for leftovers since I was going to the show afterward.  Indeed, when the small showed up, it ended up being about twice as much as I usually order.  The pizza took about 10 minutes to prepare, and was served piping hot to me at my table by the woman I'd ordered from.  Another odd exchange with her ensued when I asked her for parmesan and oregano, to which she responded they didn't have the latter (what pizza place doesn't have oregano or Italian seasoning?!?), but she could bring me parsley.  In terms of quality, I found the pie resoundingly average, with a sweet, non-crispy crust, a bland sauce, and nondescript cheese.  This pie was on the level of a Mineo's--and that's not a compliment.  However, it was at least filling--which it better have been, given that it contained twice as many slices as I usually eat--so it sustained me through the show without a problem.  Overall, I was underwhelmed by my experience at Cafe Milano, despite that I don't exactly have high expectations of pizza parlors.  I was particularly put off by the high-pressure upselling tactics of the woman I dealt with--perhaps the sales techniques of Christos next door are rubbing off on Milano's employees?  In any case, next time I'm looking for a casual, inexpensive pizza slice or pie in the Cultural District, I'll look elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Milano - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small (10&#34;) cheese pizza

IeGNsySpcpXic41Yu1cX3Q.text: Decided I'd do the "lunch special #10" which comes with a slice of pizza, small salad and a medium drink for $6.90. It's a dollar extra for each pizza topping; I elected to splurge the extra buck and get pepperoni on my slice. While in line I noticed the hoagies that were being served... they looked really good and I almost changed my mind. "Maybe next time", I thought. At 12:22 PM I placed the order, paid my total of $8.45 (including tax), was asked if this order was for "eat in or to go" (it was for "eat in") and I found a table to sit down at.  The salad came out quickly. It was fresh with what you would expect; lettuce, tomato, spinach, cucumber and onion. But what made me smile is that they had raspberry vinaigrette available. My favorite! I enjoyed the salad while waiting for my slice.   I did notice while waiting and watching Sports Center on the TV above the checkout counter that the dining area is kept remarkably clean. "Good for them", I thought. But as I continued to wait and watch Sport Center, twenty minutes later, for a single slice of pepperoni pizza, I couldn't help but notice that there were only five other customers in the dining area (three of which already had their food) and I began to wonder if I was going to be late (again) returning to the office.  25 minutes later, no slice.   At 12:50 I inquired about the single slice of pepperoni pizza and requested it in a "to go" box. I walked out the door with a single slice of pepperoni pizza in a box at 12:58.  I enjoyed my single slice of pepperoni pizza back at the office. It was a large slice with a generous amount of pepperoni and it tasted pretty good. Not the warmest slice I ever had, mind you, but it was tasty.   I doubt though that I'll ever find the time to see if the hoagies are any good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Milano - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pepperoni Slice
Photo of Cafe Milano - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Interior
Photo of Cafe Milano - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small Salad

YsGpfRXYELI6VJ4m5A50Kw.text: Ahhh Cafe Milano!! How I miss thee.  I used to live downtown and Cafe Milano was my go-to. I always got a cheese pizza with green peppers and onions (my go-to) but it's just so good! And cheap. All around a win. They also have a nice seating area upstairs that is good to people-watch, which is always a favorite activity of mine.  The other thing I love about Cafe Milano is they sell pizza on the sidwalk before Pirates games. I always grab a slice before going in - the quality is much better than anything you could find inside PNC Park, the slices are huge, and they're only $3! Can't beat that. It is cash only (for the pre-game pizza), so keep that in mind.

PUmSNMxd-km10GTDtCQQag.text: Cafe Milano makes one enormous and enormously savory pie, one that has a puffy, doughy outer edge, generous toppings, stretchy, velvety cheese, and a piquant, but mildly sweet sauce that will have you thinking of it for days and days.   On a recent visit, Kay, myself, and some friends took on an extra large (16 cuts) pizza platter that was embellished with gorgeously, scrumptiously caramelized bacon and red onions. A tremendous pizza that stands on a platform above many in the area, it comes strongly recommended from me, a man who eats far too many of them.   What underwhelmed me were the brown, overdone fries, which also came off as bagged and frozen and not at all properly freshly cut.   When we dined here, the upstairs dining room was buzzing with activity and packed with hungry customers. The poor staff, including our kind and incredibly photogenic server, were almost overcome by the deluge of commerce on an insanely busy Friday night. Despite that, the service was on-point for the most part, our waitress earning herself a hefty tip for what might as well have been combat pay.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Milano - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Extra large (16 cuts) bacon and red onion pizza
Photo of Cafe Milano - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Cafe Milano - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Upstairs dining room

eeUNv_C7wsYgiYVCV1vQ4Q.text: Good food, good prices, great staff. Pizza Is very good, pepperoni rolls even better. Several lunch specials. During the week, very hard to find a table 11.30 - 12.30, very busy; unless u reserve a table. A group from work go here 3-4 times a month.

e1GVqWZiLbjLgRCUJHb0XQ.text: I've never been to the actual restaurant so I can't speak to the service in store, but I do order from this location now and again. The pizza is pretty good and the delivery doesn't take as long as some. This is why I gave the restaurant two stars. Unfortunately, the delivery drivers constantly forget items and have to either refund money or come back later with what they didn't bring the first time. I understand that people make mistakes, but you have one job- make sure all of the stuff is with all of the other stuff I ordered and then bring it to me. That's it! This will probably be the last time I order from them.
